body:
Comment 1: 
The math package function call math.Sqrt(5) is always executed at run-time (not
compile-time), even when the argument value is a constant.

The cmplx, real, and imag functions are built-in functions.

"A constant value is represented by an integer, floating-point, imaginary, character, or
string literal, an identifier denoting a constant, a constant expression, or the result
value of some built-in functions such as unsafe.Sizeof applied to any value, cap or len
applied to some expressions, real and imag applied to a complex constant and cmplx
applied to numeric constants. The boolean truth values are represented by the
predeclared constants true and false. The predeclared identifier iota denotes an integer
constant."

"Constant expressions may contain only constant operands and are evaluated at
compile-time."

Constants, 
http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Constants

Constant expressions, 
http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Constant_expressions
